refnamediv.refpurpose: support for manipulating lists of hook functions.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GHookList, GHook and their related functions provide support for lists of hook functions. Functions can be added and removed from the lists, and the list of hook functions can be invoked.

refsect2.title: struct GHookList
refsect2.para: The GHookList struct represents a list of hook functions.

listitem.simpara: the next free GHook id.
the size of the GHookList elements, in bytes.
1 if the GHookList has been initialized.
the first GHook element in the list.
the GMemChunk used for allocating the GHook elements.
the function to call to finalize a GHook element. The default behaviour is to call the hooks destroy function.

refsect2.title: GHookFinalizeFunc ()
refsect2.para: Defines the type of function to be called when a hook in a list of hooks gets finalized.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
the hook in hook_list that gets finalized.

refsect2.title: struct GHook
refsect2.para: The GHook struct represents a single hook function in a GHookList.

listitem.simpara: data which is passed to func when this hook is invoked.
pointer to the next hook in the list.
pointer to the previous hook in the list.
the reference count of this hook.
the id of this hook, which is unique within its list.
flags which are set for this hook. See GHookFlagMask for predefined flags.
the function to call when this hook is invoked. The possible signatures for this function are GHookFunc and GHookCheckFunc.
the default finalize_hook function of a GHookList calls this member of the hook that is being finalized.

refsect2.title: GHookFunc ()
refsect2.para: Defines the type of a hook function that can be invoked by g_hook_list_invoke().

listitem.simpara: the data field of the GHook is passed to the hook function here.

refsect2.title: GHookCheckFunc ()
refsect2.para: Defines the type of a hook function that can be invoked by g_hook_list_invoke_check().

listitem.simpara: the data field of the GHook is passed to the hook function here.
FALSE if the GHook should be destroyed.

refsect2.title: g_hook_list_init ()
refsect2.para: Initializes a GHookList. This must be called before the GHookList is used.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
the size of each element in the GHookList, typically sizeof (GHook).

refsect2.title: g_hook_list_invoke ()
refsect2.para: Calls all of the GHook functions in a GHookList.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
TRUE if functions which are already running (e.g. in another thread) can be called. If set to FALSE, these are skipped.

refsect2.title: g_hook_list_invoke_check ()
refsect2.para: Calls all of the GHook functions in a GHookList. Any function which returns TRUE is removed from the GHookList.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
TRUE if functions which are already running (e.g. in another thread) can be called. If set to FALSE, these are skipped.

refsect2.programlisting: void g_hook_list_marshal (GHookList *hook_list, gboolean may_recurse, GHookMarshaller marshaller, gpointer marshal_data);
refsect2.para: Calls a function on each valid GHook.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
TRUE if hooks which are currently running (e.g. in another thread) are considered valid. If set to FALSE, these are skipped.
the function to call for each GHook.
data to pass to marshaller.

refsect2.title: GHookMarshaller ()
refsect2.para: Defines the type of function used by g_hook_list_marshal().

listitem.simpara: a GHook.
user data.

refsect2.title: g_hook_list_marshal_check ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_hook_list_marshal_check (GHookList *hook_list, gboolean may_recurse, GHookCheckMarshaller marshaller, gpointer marshal_data);
refsect2.para: Calls a function on each valid GHook and destroys it if the function returns FALSE.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
TRUE if hooks which are currently running (e.g. in another thread) are considered valid. If set to FALSE, these are skipped.
the function to call for each GHook.
data to pass to marshaller.

refsect2.title: GHookCheckMarshaller ()
refsect2.para: Defines the type of function used by g_hook_list_marshal_check().

listitem.simpara: a GHook.
user data.
FALSE if hook should be destroyed.

refsect2.title: g_hook_list_clear ()
refsect2.para: Removes all the GHook elements from a GHookList.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.

refsect2.title: g_hook_alloc ()
refsect2.para: Allocates space for a GHook and initializes it.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
a new GHook.

refsect2.title: g_hook_append()
refsect2.para: Appends a GHook onto the end of a GHookList.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
the GHook to add to the end of hook_list.

refsect2.title: g_hook_prepend ()
refsect2.para: Prepends a GHook on the start of a GHookList.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
the GHook to add to the start of hook_list.

refsect2.title: g_hook_insert_before ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a GHook into a GHookList, before a given GHook.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
the GHook to insert the new GHook before.
the GHook to insert.

refsect2.title: g_hook_insert_sorted ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a GHook into a GHookList, sorted by the given function.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
the GHook to insert.
the comparison function used to sort the GHook elements.

refsect2.title: GHookCompareFunc ()
refsect2.para: Defines the type of function used to compare GHook elements in g_hook_insert_sorted().

listitem.simpara: the GHook being inserted.
the GHook to compare with new_hook.
a value <= 0 if new_hook should be before sibling.

refsect2.title: g_hook_compare_ids ()
refsect2.para: Compares the ids of two GHook elements, returning a negative value if the second id is greater than the first.

listitem.simpara: a GHook.
a GHook to compare with new_hook.
a value <= 0 if the id of sibling is >= the id of new_hook.

refsect2.title: g_hook_get ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GHook with the given id, or NULL if it is not found.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
a hook id.
the GHook with the given id, or NULL if it is not found.

refsect2.title: g_hook_find ()
refsect2.programlisting: GHook* g_hook_find (GHookList *hook_list, gboolean need_valids, GHookFindFunc func, gpointer data);
refsect2.para: Finds a GHook in a GHookList using the given function to test for a match.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
TRUE if GHook elements which have been destroyed should be skipped.
the function to call for each GHook, which should return TRUE when the GHook has been found.
the data to pass to func.
the found GHook or NULL if no matching GHook is found.

refsect2.title: GHookFindFunc ()
refsect2.para: Defines the type of the function passed to g_hook_find().

listitem.simpara: a GHook.
user data passed to g_hook_find_func().
TRUE if the required GHook has been found.

refsect2.title: g_hook_find_data ()
refsect2.para: Finds a GHook in a GHookList with the given data.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
TRUE if GHook elements which have been destroyed should be skipped.
the data to find.
the GHook with the given data or NULL if no matching GHook is found.

refsect2.title: g_hook_find_func ()
refsect2.para: Finds a GHook in a GHookList with the given function.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
TRUE if GHook elements which have been destroyed should be skipped.
the function to find.
the GHook with the given func or NULL if no matching GHook is found.

refsect2.title: g_hook_find_func_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: GHook* g_hook_find_func_data (GHookList *hook_list, gboolean need_valids, gpointer func, gpointer data);
refsect2.para: Finds a GHook in a GHookList with the given function and data.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
TRUE if GHook elements which have been destroyed should be skipped.
the function to find.
the data to find.
the GHook with the given func and data or NULL if no matching GHook is found.

refsect2.title: g_hook_first_valid ()
refsect2.para: Returns the first GHook in a GHookList which has not been destroyed. The reference count for the GHook is incremented, so you must call g_hook_unref() to restore it when no longer needed. (Or call g_hook_next_valid() if you are stepping through the GHookList.)

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
TRUE if hooks which are currently running (e.g. in another thread) are considered valid. If set to FALSE, these are skipped.
the first valid GHook, or NULL if none are valid.

refsect2.title: g_hook_next_valid ()
refsect2.para: Returns the next GHook in a GHookList which has not been destroyed. The reference count for the GHook is incremented, so you must call g_hook_unref() to restore it when no longer needed. (Or continue to call g_hook_next_valid() until NULL is returned.)

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
the current GHook.
TRUE if hooks which are currently running (e.g. in another thread) are considered valid. If set to FALSE, these are skipped.
the next valid GHook, or NULL if none are valid.

refsect2.title: enum GHookFlagMask
refsect2.para: Flags used internally in the GHook implementation.

listitem.simpara: set if the hook has not been destroyed.
set if the hook is currently being run.

refsect2.title: G_HOOK_FLAGS()
refsect2.para: Returns the flags of a hook.

listitem.simpara: a GHook.

refsect2.title: G_HOOK_FLAG_USER_SHIFT
refsect2.para: The position of the first bit which is not reserved for internal use be the GHook implementation, i.e. 1 << G_HOOK_FLAG_USER_SHIFT is the first bit which can be used for application-defined flags.

refsect2.title: G_HOOK()
refsect2.para: Casts a pointer to a GHook*.

listitem.simpara: a pointer.

refsect2.title: G_HOOK_IS_VALID()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the GHook is valid, i.e. it is in a GHookList, it is active and it has not been destroyed.

listitem.simpara: a GHook.
TRUE if the GHook is valid.

refsect2.title: G_HOOK_ACTIVE()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the GHook is active, which is normally TRUE until the GHook is destroyed.

listitem.simpara: a GHook.
TRUE if the GHook is active.

refsect2.title: G_HOOK_IN_CALL()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the GHook function is currently executing.

listitem.simpara: a GHook.
TRUE if the GHook function is currently executing.

refsect2.title: G_HOOK_IS_UNLINKED()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the GHook is not in a GHookList.

listitem.simpara: a GHook.
TRUE if the GHook is not in a GHookList.

refsect2.title: g_hook_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increments the reference count for a GHook.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
the GHook to increment the reference count of.

refsect2.title: g_hook_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrements the reference count of a GHook. If the reference count falls to 0, the GHook is removed from the GHookList and g_hook_free() is called to free it.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
the GHook to unref.

refsect2.title: g_hook_free ()
refsect2.para: Calls the GHookList hook_free function if it exists, and frees the memory allocated for the GHook.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
the GHook to free.

refsect2.title: g_hook_destroy ()
refsect2.para: Destroys a GHook, given its ID.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
a hook ID.
TRUE if the GHook was found in the GHookList and destroyed.

refsect2.title: g_hook_destroy_link ()
refsect2.para: Removes one GHook from a GHookList, marking it inactive and calling g_hook_unref() on it.

listitem.simpara: a GHookList.
the GHook to remove.
